fields.description:
Observing this when running the instances sequence...

{code}
Executing wait_for_text_present_by_id id = 'pagetitle', text = 'Details for key pair: njekgj-key-pair'
Verified text Details for key pair: njekgj-key-pair present in element by id = pagetitle
Executing wait_for_visible_by_css('.actions-menu>span>a'), timeout_in_seconds is set to 60
Element by css = '.actions-menu>span>a' was located in DOM and is visible.
Executing click_element_by_css_robust ('#resource-menuitem-images')
Executing wait_for_clickable_by_css('#resource-menuitem-images')
Found clickable element by css = '#resource-menuitem-images'
Executing wait_for_visible_by_css('#resource-menuitem-images'), timeout_in_seconds is set to 60
Element by css = '#resource-menuitem-images' was located in DOM and is visible.
Executing click_element_by_css('#resource-menuitem-images')
Clicking on element by css = ('#resource-menuitem-images')
Executing check_visibility_by_css('li.current>a:contains('Images')')
Element by css = 'li.current>a:contains('Images')' not visible.
Executing check_visibility_by_css('#resource-menuitem-images')
Element by css = '#resource-menuitem-images' was located in DOM and is visible.
Executing wait_for_text_present_by_id id = 'pagetitle', text = 'Images'
{code}

Browser is stuck on keypair detail page after keypair creation, with Firefox displaying the keypair download indicator.
fields.summary: Instances functional test sequence is failing on keypair creation

comments.body: [~alice]: I'm unable to run the instances sequence, so this is blocking my work on GUI-2320
[~kgill] I see this in the CI tests run by Jenkins. I am looking into it.
Will commit fix in GUI-2422 branch.

[~kgill]  I traced the failure back to navigation failure to Images page. I saw this in selenium webdriver log:

{code}
19:52:09.712 INFO [87] org.openqa.selenium.remote.server.DriverServlet - Executing: [find element: By.cssSelector: li.current>a:contains('Images')])
19:52:09.955 WARN [87] org.openqa.selenium.remote.server.DriverServlet - Exception thrown
org.openqa.selenium.InvalidSelectorException: The given selector li.current>a:contains('Images') is either invalid or does not result in a WebElement. The following error occurred:
InvalidSelectorError: An invalid or illegal selector was specified
Command duration or timeout: 8 milliseconds
For documentation on this error, please visit: http://seleniumhq.org/exceptions/invalid_selector_exception.html
Build info: version: '2.48.2', revision: '41bccdd', time: '2015-10-09 19:59:12'
System info: host: 'euca-10-111-76-210', ip: '10.111.76.210', os.name: 'Linux', os.arch: 'amd64', os.version: '3.2.0-58-virtual', java.version: '1.7.0_80'
*** Element info: {Using=css selector, value=li.current>a:contains('Images')}
Session ID: 4c6ac816-953c-44a8-9412-8c2a1aa10407
Driver info: org.openqa.selenium.firefox.FirefoxDriver
Capabilities [{platform=LINUX, acceptSslCerts=true, javascriptEnabled=true, cssSelectorsEnabled=true, databaseEnabled=true, browserName=firefox, handlesAlerts=true, nativeEvents=false, webStorageEnabled=true, rotatable=false, locationContextEnabled=true, applicationCacheEnabled=true, takesScreenshot=true, version=42.0}]
        at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.java:57)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.java:45)
        at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Constructor.java:526)
        at org.openqa.selenium.remote.ErrorHandler.createThrowable(ErrorHandler.java:206)
        at org.openqa.selenium.remote.ErrorHandler.throwIfResponseFailed(ErrorHandler.java:158)
        at org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebDriver.execute(RemoteWebDriver.java:647)
        at org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebDriver.findElement(RemoteWebDriver.java:353)
        at org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebDriver.findElementByCssSelector(RemoteWebDriver.java:482)
        at org.openqa.selenium.By$ByCssSelector.findElement(By.java:430)
        at org.openqa.selenium.remote.RemoteWebDriver.findElement(RemoteWebDriver.java:345)
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor9.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
        at org.openqa.selenium.support.events.EventFiringWebDriver$2.invoke(EventFiringWebDriver.java:102)
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy1.findElement(Unknown Source)
        at org.openqa.selenium.support.events.EventFiringWebDriver.findElement(EventFiringWebDriver.java:187)
        at org.openqa.selenium.remote.server.handler.FindElement.call(FindElement.java:48)
        at org.openqa.selenium.remote.server.handler.FindElement.call(FindElement.java:1)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
        at org.openqa.selenium.remote.server.DefaultSession$1.run(DefaultSession.java:176)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: org.openqa.selenium.InvalidSelectorException: The given selector li.current>a:contains('Images') is either invalid or does not result in a WebElement. The following error occurred:
InvalidSelectorError: An invalid or illegal selector was specified
For documentation on this error, please visit: http://seleniumhq.org/exceptions/invalid_selector_exception.html

{code}

I added extra comments to the code and found that the following part of the while loop not being executed, despite the check going through, and test already inside the loop

{code}
try:
                time.sleep(1)
                print "Hitting enter. Executing attempt " + str(k)
                self.send_keys_by_id(css, "\n", clear_field=False)
            except Exception, e:
                print str(k) + "-th attempt to hit enter unsuccessful."
            is_visible = self.check_visibility_by_css(element_css_on_next_page)
            k = k + 1
{code}

[~kgill] The click_robust_by_css method it checks visibility of 'li.current>a:contains('Images') after clicking the Images nav button. 
I had the test output the visibility status of 'li.current>a:contains('Images'). On visibility=False the test goes and executes click on the nav button and repeats the check/try up to 6 times. However, the test did not go into the while loop at all:


{code}
Executing check_visibility_by_css('li.current>a:contains('Images')')
Element by css = 'li.current>a:contains('Images')' not visible.
Checked visibility on li.current>a:contains('Images')Visibility status: False
Executing Attempt 1

Executing check_visibility_by_css('#resource-menuitem-images')
Element by css = '#resource-menuitem-images' was located in DOM and is visible.
Executing wait_for_text_present_by_id id = 'pagetitle', text = 'Images'
ERROR: Timed out. Could not verify presence of text = 'Images' in element by id = 'pagetitle' timeout_in_seconds = 120

{code}

Selenium python bindings don't find  #resource-menuitem-images, apparently.
Output from the log while running test locally. The test does not click the button because it does not see the element in the DOM. This is very starange, because I can see the element in VNC, I put additional timeouts around the click and I can perform click by the same id just fine with Selenium IDE. 

{code}
Executing send_keys_by_id id=#resource-menuitem-images, text=

Executing wait_for_visible_by_id('#resource-menuitem-images'), timeout_in_seconds is set to 60
ERROR: Timed out: element by id = '#resource-menuitem-images' not visible.
Checking whether element by id = '#resource-menuitem-images' present in the DOM.
ERROR: Element by id = '#resource-menuitem-images' not found in the DOM.
{code}

[~alice]: Thanks for the PR.  I pushed a commit to resolve merge conflicts in PR 1792.  Could you review the commit to ensure I got the right code?  It's at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/39d62c04751774b2f

Also, should we close this ticket as a dupe of GUI-2422?  If so, feel free to assign 2422 to me for review and I'll merge the PR after Jenkins passes.

[~kgill] after you updated the branch I was seeing failures in the autoscaling sequence. I fixed the code to better deal with confirm scaling policy modal and pushed the change here https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1792, and now I am not seeing any failures there, but verify_charts_on_monitoring_page method fails to find the charts
{code}
Looking for element id = 'cwchart-CPUUtilization-Average' in the DOM
ERROR: Timed out. Did not find element by id = 'cwchart-CPUUtilization-Average'.
Executing wait_for_element_present_by_id('cwchart-DiskReadBytes-Average')
Looking for element id = 'cwchart-DiskReadBytes-Average' in the DOM
ERROR: Timed out. Did not find element by id = 'cwchart-DiskReadBytes-Average'.
Executing wait_for_element_present_by_id('cwchart-DiskReadOps-Average')
Looking for element id = 'cwchart-DiskReadOps-Average' in the DOM
ERROR: Timed out. Did not find element by id = 'cwchart-DiskReadOps-Average'.
Executing wait_for_element_present_by_id('cwchart-DiskWriteBytes-Average')
Looking for element id = 'cwchart-DiskWriteBytes-Average' in the DOM
ERROR: Timed out. Did not find element by id = 'cwchart-DiskWriteBytes-Average'.
Executing wait_for_element_present_by_id('cwchart-DiskWriteOps-Average')
Looking for element id = 'cwchart-DiskWriteOps-Average' in the DOM
ERROR: Timed out. Did not find element by id = 'cwchart-DiskWriteOps-Average'.
Executing wait_for_element_present_by_id('cwchart-NetworkIn-Average')
Looking for element id = 'cwchart-NetworkIn-Average' in the DOM
ERROR: Timed out. Did not find element by id = 'cwchart-NetworkIn-Average'.
Executing wait_for_element_present_by_id('cwchart-NetworkOut-Average')
Looking for element id = 'cwchart-NetworkOut-Average' in the DOM
ERROR: Timed out. Did not find element by id = 'cwchart-NetworkOut-Average'.
Executing click_element_by_id_robust ('resource-menuitem-scalinggroups'
{code}

wait_for_element_present notes the exception but does not raise an error presently. I can change that or add an option for it in the method.

[~kgill] I pushed another robustness fix for volumes sequence. The tests have passed http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/user-console-regression-sequence/15138/ 
Feel free to merge. Let's open a separate ticket to address verify_charts_on_monitoring_page method is asg_detail.py
